author: Anthony Harrup
title: Mexican Inflation Ended 2017 at Highest Level in 17 Years - WSJ
text:
MEXICO CITYâ€”Mexican inflation accelerated in 2017 to its fastest rate in 17 years, led by higher food and energy costs that were affected by a weaker peso and an end to government controls on gasoline and other fuels.
The consumer-price index rose 0.59% in December, bringing the annual inflation rate to 6.77%, the National Statistics Institute said Tuesday. It was the highest rate since May 2001, and the most for a calendar year since 2000.
